rev.comment: We're not an advertising medium, or a forteller of the future
rev.diff:
Line 30: Line 30:
Having been released on 24 April, "Guilt" debuted at number 8 in the UK. The London duo's debut album ''[[Welcome Reality (Album)|Welcome Reality]]'' was released on 15 August 2011 and features tracks "Innocence", "Me & You", "Guilt" and "Promises". The latter track, "Promises" made its debut on 17 May when Zane Lowe named it ''Hottest Record in the World'' - the third consecutive single from the duo to achieve this feat. On 14 August 2011, "Promises" debuted at number 1 in the UK singles chart. Their debut album entitled "Welcome Reality" was released on 15 August 2011 and debuted at number 1 in the UK album chart. They also produced [[Example|Example's]] single [[Stay Awake (song)|Stay Awake]] which also topped the charts in 2011.
Having been released on 24 April, "Guilt" debuted at number 8 in the UK. The London duo's debut album ''[[Welcome Reality (Album)|Welcome Reality]]'' was released on 15 August 2011 and features tracks "Innocence", "Me & You", "Guilt" and "Promises". The latter track, "Promises" made its debut on 17 May when Zane Lowe named it ''Hottest Record in the World'' - the third consecutive single from the duo to achieve this feat. On 14 August 2011, "Promises" debuted at number 1 in the UK singles chart. Their debut album entitled "Welcome Reality" was released on 15 August 2011 and debuted at number 1 in the UK album chart. They also produced [[Example|Example's]] single [[Stay Awake (song)|Stay Awake]] which also topped the charts in 2011.

On Friday 25 November, Nero perform at the UK's biggest bass music all-nighter of 2011, UKF Bass Culture at Alexandra Palace with a full live performance.
